Title: Brunei ratifies Kigali Amendment
Summary: BRUNEI DARUSSALAM: Brunei Darussalam has become the latest country to have officially ratify the Kigali Amendment to phase down HFCs.

Title: Johnson Controls awarded $156m US defence contract
Summary: USA: Johnson Controls has been awarded a $156m contract to supply chillers and related equipment to the US Department of Defense.

Title: Hanon passes 1 million eCompressor milestone
Summary: SOUTH KOREA: Hanon Systems, supplier of components for Volkswagen Group’s MEB platform for electric cars, has passed the production landmark of 1 million electric CO2 compressors.

Title: Concern over high AC refill rates in India
Summary: INDIA: A new report into India’s rapidly growing residential air conditioning market and its potential effects on global warming has revealed refill rates far higher than the global norm.

Title: Guterres urges full implementation of Kigali
Summary: USA: United Nations secretary general António Guterres has urged governments to fully ratify and implement the Kigali Amendment to phase down HFCs.

Title: Man sentenced for smuggling R22
Summary: USA: A man who confessed to smuggling five cylinders of illegal R22 refrigerant into the USA has been sentenced to three-years' probation, including 15 days’ time served.

Title: Austria wins gold at EuroSkills
Summary: DENMARK: Austrian Jonas Danninger, an employee of Hauser GmbH, won the Refrigeration and Air Conditioning gold medal at last week’s EuroSkills competition in Herning, Denmark.

Title: Carrier completes 10-14ton RTU challenge
Summary: USA: Carrier has become the first manufacturer to complete the US Department of Energy's Commercial Building HVAC Technology Challenge laboratory validation in the 10-14ton rooftop heat pump category.

Title: Danfoss sells Dutch subsidiary Sondex BV
Summary: DENMARK/NETHERLANDS: Danfoss Plate Heat Exchangers has sold its Dutch heat exchanger subsidiary, Sondex BV, to heat exchanger experts Theo Thoen and Hans Ter Velde.

Title: Saudi Arabia joins Kigali pledge
Summary: SAUDI ARABIA: The Kingdom of Saudi Arabia has become the latest country to have officially accepted the Kigali Amendment to phase down HFCs.

Title: Worker dies in refrigerant plant leak
Summary: INDIA: One person died and 12 were reportedly hospitalised on Wednesday (10 September) after a leak in a pipeline at the Gujarat Fluorochemicals refrigerant plant in Ranjitnagar, India.

Title: Smardt Chillers in Indian data centre deal
Summary: CANADA/INDIA: Montreal-based Smardt Chillers is to supply its oil-free centrifugal chillers to Indian company Shree Refrigerations, a leading player in cooling solutions serving the defence sector.

Title: Trane sounds the NYSE opening bell
Summary: USA: Trane Technologies has rung the New York Stock Exchange opening bell to celebrate its fifth year as an HVACR-focused company.

Title: Leak testing with oxygen caused heat pump blast
Summary: POLAND: Authorities in Opole have concluded that the heat pump explosion in Chrząstowice that killed two people last year was caused by using oxygen to carry out pressure tests.

Title: IOR president is “Local Hero”
Summary: UK: Institute of Refrigeration president Lisa-Jayne Cook was amongst the winners last night at the Top 100 Most Influential Women in Construction Awards 2025.

Title: Taking heat pumps to Holyrood
Summary: UK: Working heat pumps were recently placed before the Scottish parliament to raise awareness of the technology and its potential role in decarbonising Scotland’s heating.

Title: Industry backs mandatory alternative refrigerants training
Summary: UK: As the RACHP Industry prepares for the revision of the F-gas regulations, the industry has shown overwhelming backing for the introduction of mandatory certified…

Title: Former Hawco MD to head K2 Engineering
Summary: UK: Martin Butler, former managing director of Hawco, has joined Surrey-based refrigeration consultants K2 Engineering (Cooling) as MD.

Title: Langford appointed Panasonic UK country manager
Summary: UK: Mick Langford has been appointed UK country manager for Panasonic’s heating and cooling division. He replaces John Kellett who has stepped down from the role for personal reasons.

Title: Paul Singh to stand for IOR president
Summary: UK: Paul Singh, owner of the Chillair (UK) Training Academy, has joined  the race to be elected as the next president of the Institute of Refrigeration (IOR).

Title: Industry recognition for Matt Morton
Summary: UK: Matt Morton, chairman of Durham-based EJM Engineered Systems, has received the Institute of Refrigeration’s Northern Branch Lifetime Achievement Award for his outstanding contribution to the industry.

Title: CTC partners with The Merchant’s Choice group
Summary: UK: Go Geothermal, the UK distributor of CTC heat pumps, has announced a partnership with The Merchant’s Choice, a specialist buying group for plumbers’ merchants.

Title: Improving service across London and the SE
Summary: UK: Wolseley brands Pipe Centre and Climate Centre have unveiled a new logistics model to improve customer service across London and the SE.

Title: Danfoss adds hygienic heat exchangers
Summary: DENMARK: Danfoss has launched a range of hygienic gasketed plate heat exchangers for a variety of applications in the food and beverage industry.

Title: Haier R32 VRF for the European market
Summary: ITALY: Haier HVAC Solutions Europe has announced a new R32 VRF system specifically tailored for the European market.

Title: Sanhua adds new sight glasses
Summary: SPAIN: Sanhua has introduced a new range of sight glasses engineered for high-pressure refrigerants.

Title: Tickets now available for IOR dinner
Summary: UK: Tickets are now available for the annual Institute of Refrigeration dinner, which returns to the Hilton London Bankside hotel on 12 February 2026.

Title: Lawton Tubes opens training studio
Summary: UK: A new training studio to help inspire the next generation of air conditioning engineers, plumbers, and medical gas technicians has been announced by copper tube supplier Lawton Tubes.
